New Records: Caden Dana became the youngest Angels pitcher since Francisco Rodríguez in 2002 -- and the club’s youngest starting pitcher since Frank Tanana in 1973.
Key Match Events: Dana set the tone in the first inning, retiring the side on 12 pitches, and recorded his first career strikeout against Cal Raleigh, who swung through a 95.1 mph four-seamer.
Pre-Game Insights: Dana said a few days before his debut, 'This is a first for me, so I know the environment is going to make it tough to keep that mindset,' but 'that's going to be a challenge.'
Post-Match Reflections: Amanda Dana, Caden's mother, reflected, 'From a mom's perspective, you always think you have a little more time before you're actually in this situation,' but 'his performance in Double-A, especially, was just unbelievable.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: Dana's close circle cheered him on from the stands, a group including parents Amanda and Fred, sister Kyleigh, one of his two brothers and three of his high school coaches from Don Bosco Preparatory High School in Ramsey, N.J.
Others: The game resulted in a 3-2 win for the Los Angeles Angels against the Seattle Mariners.
